snippet: The Obama administration identified dozens of institutions, including public, private, obscure and elite schools, that are being investigated for possible violations of anti-discrimination laws.
abstract: Obama administration releases names of 55 colleges and universities under investigation for their handling of sexual assault complains; unusual step of identifying dozens of institutions, including public, private, obscure and elite schools, is meant to increase pressure on institutions to crack down on problem on their campuses.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and DAVID S. JOACHIM

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration identified dozens of institutions, including public, private, obscure and elite schools, that are being investigated for possible violations of anti-discrimination laws.

headline.main: 55 Colleges Named in Federal Inquiry Into Handling of Sexual Assault Cases
headline.print_headline: 55 Colleges Named in Federal Inquiry Into Handling of Sexual Assault Cases
